updates on two explosions near the grave of
Iranian general Wasem Simani on March 3  In January,
Iranian state television quoted the
country's health minister as saying the death toll
was 95, down from 103
previously reported. There were also 211
other people injured in what was considered an
attack.  causing the highest number of deaths
in Iran's history. The two women took place
about 20 minutes apart. The first incident
occurred 700 meters from Mr. Simani's grave. The second incident occurred
1 kilometer away. Tasnim news agency reported that two
briefcases containing explosives were placed.  at the
entrance to the cemetery and was detonated from afar.
So far, no organization has claimed
responsibility for the attacks, but
